content: Really nice!

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Takes a while to set up -> works first try -> that's exact cover for you.

You once again did a great job with the visuals and diversity of the test cases.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Another great job! More comments in the history.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle, enough difference with Polyominoes to justify a second puzzle, might be somewhere between a medium & difficult puzzle.
Is anybody trying to code a non-DLX-backtracking solution?

I like the new input a lot better. It feels more natural to me. A couple of things to tidy up:

1) I think you can completely get rid of the ASCII representation section now, right?

2) In two different places, you used 'x' and 'y'. I believe those should both be 'r' and 'c'. The x data definitely corresponds to rows and the y data to columns.

3) Thank you for the link my tutorial! Please remove the hyphen between "Algorithm" and "X". The URL does have a hyphen, but that is just because Tech.io replaces all spaces with hyphens when it generates URLs. I am already working on pages for your two puzzles, so maybe can you eventually put the link right to the Tetrasticks page.

{{Memory lapse deleted.}}

Another outstanding job!

I like @5DN1Ls suggestion:

Alternatively to providing the 18x18 game board description, would it be easier to just provide the ID of and which board edges have been occupied by each tetrastick already placed on the board?

Example (for illustration only, may be presented differently):
J 0 0 0 1 | 0 0 1 0 | 1 0 1 1 | 1 1 1 2

Having finished the puzzle, I am left wanting more. Could you have test cases that are different shapes and sizes? I am going to blame this monster idea on you. It was your idea to create the solo player game which has the cool graphics and now I crave MORE test cases. I expect my code will solve any new test case, so I think I'm just craving more visual stimulation! (There are some really cool shapes made out of Tetrasticks on the Internet.
Testcases ready, moving contribution to "READY" state

I understand that the contribution is still in WIP. Please forgive me if some of the comments below are too early at the moment üôáüèª

Rules
* Please change "a board description, that have" to "the description of a board, that has".

* Please change "4 line segment" to "4 line segments".

* Please add "the" before "same intersection".

* Please break the overview into two rows (similar to what you had before) for clarity.

* Please show how each tetrastick is represented in actual input (similar to what you had before), because such information is vital for parsing.

* Not sure whether it's CG's cache issue? The old image showing no crosses is still shown instead of the new image, even when I check the website on another browser ü§î Hopefully the issue will resolve itself later‚Ä¶?

* Suggest to change "grid of squares" to "board of squares".

* Suggest to change "even better" to "more precisely".

* Please explain which point or edge of a tetrastick we are talking about when we say we want to place it on (row, column). (Say, use an unflipped, unrotated J-shaped tetrastick as an example.)

Example
* It's better to show the F/R example with the full F/R pieces for easier understanding.

* Please add "the" before "J-shaped", "board" and "example".

* Please change "therefor" to "therefore" ("therefor" is an old word), and add a comma before the word.

* Please change "Z shaped" to "the Z-shaped" (with a hyphen).

* Please add "a" before "horizontal flip".

Game input
* Please mention that game board consists of either <const>.</const> for an unoccupied space or a tetrastick ID for an occupied space.

Output
* Please delete "before placing on board" because it seems to imply that flipping is performed after rotations.

* Please add a comma before "0 otherwise".

* Please change "h - shaped" to "h-shaped".

* Please change "placed to" to "placed on".

Stub
* Please change "read remaining:string(17)" to "loopline n remaining:word(1)".

Thanks.

Alternatively to providing the 18x18 game board description, would it be easier to just provide the ID of and which board edges have been occupied by each tetrastick already placed on the board?

Example (for illustration only, may be presented differently):
J 0 0 0 1 | 0 0 1 0 | 1 0 1 1 | 1 1 1 2
Ok fine... I'll rework the inputs :D Seems like something that would be appreciated

I do think it's necessary to show what the segments are for each tetrastick, and that's why I suggested (in my separate thread of comments) to keep the existing representations and modified the headings only.

But if @VizGhar doesn't mind more significant changes, I would go even further to suggest you to remove both the visual and the ASCII representations in the statement. Instead, just show the same tetrasticks as the ones shown in the viewer, so that the segments of each tetrastick and the part of the grid which acts as the bounding box (mentioned in the later part of the statement) are clearly shown, something like this (for all 16 tetrasticks):

https://imgur.com/a/JG3ZZFW

I think it's much more relevant that way.
I've solved this one and 'Polyominoes' without DLX, it's feasible :D
TY. I'll probably change difficulty level to hard.
Thank you :) enjoy
Thank you :) enjoy
Tetrasticks can even be solved by bitboarding I suppose, since the grid is always same size and there are 60 line segments. Also bitboarding operations for this puzzle are simple

We may also want to have a think about how best to describe the segments. The current description is:

"each tetrastick is composed of 4 line segments"

But prima facie a tetrastick may not look that way, e.g. the I-shaped tetrastick looks like it's 1-segment, and the L-shaped tetrastick 2-segment. Not sure how best to rewrite the description, something like "each tetrastick is composed of 4 1-unit-long line segments", or "each tetrastick is composed of line segments which always have a length of 4 units in total"?
Didn't see your last comment before uploading new version. But I've added more descriptive image, where segments are clearly visible, so it might be enough even without changing description

Yes, that looks great! It should be clear enough for players to work out the bounding box for each tetrastick without showing the underlying grid, I guess?

The only issue now is that in Fig 1, N and Z have been flipped horizontally once. Please change them to their no-flip version üòâ.

Thanks.
oh nice catch... double check is still not enough :facepalm:
done

The new Fig 1 is beautiful! I think it clearly demonstrates how each tetrastick is "composed of 4 line segments" and the shape of each tetrastick. I am often a visual person and the colors help me understand the pieces very quickly compared to just the black and white.

@5DN1L >> It should be clear enough for players to work out the bounding box for each tetrastick without showing the underlying grid, I guess?

I think it is clear enough. It is a puzzle after all, and I think it is not unreasonable to expect the player to look at Fig 2 and develop their own understanding of bounding boxes.

I will make a new post up top as I am interested to hear if anybody has tried a non-DLX-backtracking approach.
It'll simplify things if input (of what's already placed on the board) is in the same format as output.
Updated... too many adjustments again. Hope we are close to finish
Can you check game statement now? I believe it's too long... So I've added some collapsible sections. I'll update stub later and probably wont update input. I'm more in favor of ascii representation.

Adding collapsible sections is a good idea.

Below is an updated list of points:

Example
* Please add "The" before "O piece".

* Please change "Therefor" to "Therefore". Reference: https://writingexplained.org/therefor-or-therefore-difference

* Please add "the" before "grid", "J-shaped", "board" and "Z-shaped".

* Please change "Whole" to "The whole".

* Please change "therefor" to "therefore", and add a comma before the word.

* Please add "a" before "horizontal flip".

Game input
* Please add "consisting of either <const>.</const> for an unoccupied space or a tetrastick ID for an occupied space" before "as described in example".

Just above Example section
* Please explain which point or edge of a tetrastick we are talking about when we say we want to place it on (row, column). Let's take an unflipped, unrotated J-shaped tetrastick as an example. What should be the output for this if I want to put it on the top-left corner of the board?
  |
|_|

ASCII representation
* I'm sorry but it's still too long to show, even if I expand the window to full width of my screen: https://imgur.com/a/elqDFGo . I think breaking the rows into 6, 5, 5 (instead of the current 9, 7) should do the trick.

* Only the F, H and O pieces are represented using those respective characters, while all the other pieces are represented using the character O only.

Stub
* Please change "read remaining:string(17)" to "loopline n remaining:word(1)".

Thanks.
This is the most verbose puzzle on codingame :P. Hopefully everything is in place now. Now the simple part - testcases

Looking good! üòâ

Below is an updated list of points:

Goal
* Please change "complete the shape" to "fill the board".

Visual representation
* Please change "tiles" to "tetrasticks".

ASCII representation
* Please change "tiles" to "tetrasticks".

Example 1
* Please change "Example 1" to "Example" (consistent with the other example heading).

* "visual representation": Does that means Fig 1? If so, the bounding box looks like 2x2 instead of 3x3‚Ä¶? Or, if you're actually referring to the ASCII representation, then please change "visual representation" to "ASCII representation of the whole board below".

* Please add "." after "column = 2".

Example - Game Board representation
* Please add a comma before "therefore".

Stub
* Please change "loopline n line:word(18)" back to "loop h read line:string(w)" (You've changed the wrong line‚Ä¶)

* Please change "read remaining:string(17)" to "loopline n remaining:word(1)".

Thank you.
Fixed, added testcases -> contribution is now hopefuly ready

We're almost there!

Rules
* Please change "a board description" to "the description of a board" (I mentioned that before and thought it had been corrected ü§î. I must have missed it).

Stub
* Please change "loop h read line:string(n)" to "loop h read line:string(w)".

Error message
* For the "Empty board Y" case, I tried to output Y 0 1 0 0", and I got the error message of "Tetrastick Y was already used", but Y isn't one of the remaining tetrasticks. It should be changed to "Tetrastick Y unavailable".

Thank you.

I appreciate the effort you put into creating the ASCII representation, but a simplified format will enhance clarity and make the puzzle even more enjoyable to solve. üòâ

Visual representation of tetrasticks
* Please add "(no flip + no rotation)" after the heading.

ASCII representation of tetrasticks
* Please change "as provided in input (no flip + no rotation)" to ", showing every segment separately".

Additional info
* Please change "Algorithm-X" to "Algorithm X".

Stub
* Under INPUT (the last part of the stub), please change "n:" to "m:". You may also add the new description for [[n]] if you want.

* Please change "line: single line of board" to "line: a tetrastick already placed".

Thank you.
